intro: Oxytropis campestris subsp. tiroliensis, commonly known as the Alpine milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Oxytropis campestris subsp. tiroliensis is adapted to cold climates and is relatively drought-resistant.
